thread.title: Jennifer Hawkins dazzles at Myer Autumn 17 fashion launch
thread.title_full: Jennifer Hawkins dazzles at Myer Autumn 17 fashion launch | Daily Mail Online

author: Sophie Haslett For Daily Mail Australia
title: Jennifer Hawkins dazzles at Myer Autumn 17 fashion launch
text:
If you thought black was boring and traditional, think again.
Jennifer Hawkins stormed the catwalk at the Myer Autumn 17 fashion launch rehearsal in Melbourne on Thursday, wearing a dramatic and daring black Alex Perry gown for the opening look.
Featuring sleeves as long as it did hemline and a sheer central panel, the Myer ambassador and international supermodel hit the red carpet at the University of Melbourne's heritage-listed underground car park.
The dress Jennifer first sported was by the Australian designer and fashion week darling, Alex Perry; it retails for AUD $1,800.
Dramatic: Jennifer Hawkins stormed the catwalk at the Myer Autumn 17 fashion launch rehearsal in Melbourne on Thursday, wearing a daring black Alex Perry gown for the opening look (pictured)
Bold: Featuring sleeves as long as it did hemline and a sheer central panel, the Myer ambassador and international supermodel hit the red carpet at the University of Melbourne's heritage-listed underground car park
Price tag: The dress Jennifer first sported was by the Australian designer and fashion week darling, Alex Perry; it retails for AUD $1,800 (pictured)
Having last year hosted a dramatic show in Sydney's Barangaroo, the renowned department store had a task on their hands to top a fake rainstorm, models on motorbikes and an exclusive dinner for 120 guests.
But never one to shy away from a challenge, the Myer Autumn 17 fashion launch rehearsal was every bit as creative and exciting as 2016, featuring two 'fashion moments' complete with Tesla cars.
Closing out the Autumn show, Jennifer Hawkins slipped into a dazzling silver Toni Maticevski gown.
The dress - made from foil fabric and featuring an exaggerated peplum hem - retails for an eye-watering $5000, and looked every bit as lavish.
Spectacle: The Myer Autumn 17 fashion launch rehearsal was every bit as creative and exciting as 2016, featuring two 'fashion moments' complete with Tesla cars (pictured: Jennifer Hawkins)
Closing out: Face of Myer, Jennifer Hawkins, closed out the show wearing a silver Toni Maticevski gown (pictured) - the dress retails for $5,000
Guest list: Guests confirmed at Thursday night's show include media, Myer designers and VIPs including Lindy Klim, Carrie Bickmore and Andy Lee
Daring: On her opening look dress, Jennifer Hawkins's gown featured a sheer panel in the centre
Elsewhere in the rehearsal, models rocked daring outfits including blazers without trousers, peplum hems and visors reminiscent of the bike helmets sported last year.
Monochrome was a repeated colour theme, and Balmain showcased several covetable pairs of thigh high boots, as well as blazers without trousers or skirts.
'With the cooler climate Melburnians [sic] really embrace autumn winter fashion, they tend to go for darker tones and luxe fabrics that can be layered,' Jennifer Hawkins said , in the lead-up to the show.
'I absolutely love hanging out in Melbourne and can't wait. It's the perfect location to host our Autumn 17 Fashion Launch.'
Excited: 'With the cooler climate Melburnians [sic] really embrace autumn winter fashion, they tend to go for darker tones and luxe fabrics that can be layered,' Jennifer Hawkins said , in the lead-up to the show
Autumnal: Elsewhere in the rehearsal, models rocked daring outfits including blazers without trousers, peplum hems and bright colours (pictured)
Show time: Thursday night's proceedings will see some 100 fashionable faces descend on Melbourne University's car park for a show in two acts
Unusual: Some models wore visors reminiscent of the bike helmets sported last year (left); monochrome was also worn in the heritage-listed car park
Would you? Balmain sent models down the catwalk sporting blazers without trousers or skirts (pictured)
Thursday night's proceedings will see some 100 fashionable faces descend on Melbourne University's car park for a show in two acts.
Guests confirmed include media, Myer designers and VIPs including Lindy Klim, Carrie Bickmore and Andy Lee.
The show takes place at a car park which was built in 1971-1972. Featuring a gothic entrance and distinctive pillars, which form an archway pattern, it is the perfect minimalist setting for the autumnal Myer offering.
The catwalk follows David Jones's autumn showcase a couple of weeks ago, in which the rival department store took over the St Mary's Cathedral forecourt in Sydney with a catwalk show starring top US model, Karlie Kloss.
